Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='HSK98B')

BibliographicData.Title: Thalamocortical connections of the parabelt auditory cortex in macaque monkeys

BrainSite.FullName: Zone of transformation between anterodorsal, ventral and posterodorsal medial geniculate nuclei

Reference.Comments: The figure is with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked behind the caudal borders of CL and CM.
"... there was only one labelled cell in MGm..." This was interpreted as no label!!!

Because the tracers vary in sensitivity, the amounts and solution concentrations were varied accordingly (typically, 0.01 to 0.05 µl at 2% for WGA-HRP; 0.1 to 0.3 µl at 2 to 10% for BDA and fluorescent tracers).

Figure with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked near the rostral end of STG. Thus I assume GP83-Ts1

Because the tracers vary in sensitivity, the amounts and solution concentrations were varied accordingly (typically, 0.01 to 0.05 µl at 2% for WGA-HRP; 0.1 to 0.3 µl at 2 to 10% for BDA and fluorescent tracers).

Because the tracers vary in sensitivity, the amounts and solution concentrations were varied accordingly (typically, 0.01 to 0.05 µl at 2% for WGA-HRP; 0.1 to 0.3 µl at 2 to 10% for BDA and fluorescent tracers).
An exact reference to the brainsite is given in the companion paper HSK99a!!

TracerSubstance.FullName: Horseradish peroxidase, conjugated to wheat germ agglutinin

Reference.Quotation: Further the photomicrograph in panel A indicates that this injection may have also involved the lateral belt and the underlying mithe matter, .... (p.860)
Reference.Comments: Because the tracers vary in sensitivity, the amounts and solution concentrations were varied accordingly (typically, 0.01 to 0.05 µl at 2% for WGA-HRP; 0.1 to 0.3 µl at 2 to 10% for BDA and fluorescent tracers).

Figure with out borders and clear brain site names. The injected site was marked on the figure in dorso-ventral direction at the axis of auditory parabelt on STG. In rostro-caudal direction it was marked rostral to RTL. Thus I assume GP83-Ts2
